#Text=Ontario Votes 2007 : Interview with Libertarian candidate Aaron
#Text=Parent , Essex
#Text=Sunday , October 7 , 2007
#Text=Aaron Parent
#Text=is running for the Libertarian in the Ontario provincial election , in the Essex riding .
#Text=Wikinews
#Text=' Nick Moreau interviewed him regarding his values , his experience , and his campaign .
#Text=Stay tuned for further interviews ; every candidate from every party is eligible , and will be contacted .

#Text=Expect interviews from Liberals , Progressive Conservatives , New Democratic Party members , Ontario Greens , as well as members from the Family Coalition , Freedom , Communist , Libertarian , and Confederation of Regions parties , as well as independents .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why have you chosen to involve yourself in the political process ?
#Text=Why did you choose to run in this constituency ?
#Text=I chose to involve myself because I ’ve never heard anyone express an unabashed love for their government .
#Text=Most people are disenchanted with the sordid affairs of politics which is why I am beseeching fellow Ontarians to vote for less government .
#Text=I ’m also passionate about absolute civil liberty and freedom of choice , something libertarians idealize but are restricted in utilizing in part from government legislation and taxation .
#Text=I chose to run in this constituency because I ’m not sure many people are familiar with libertarian ideology and I wanted to educate and hopefully invigorate potential voters .
#Text=What prior political experience do you have ?
#Text=What skills and insight can you bring to office , from other non-political positions you may have held ?
#Text=None , per se .
#Text=I am , however , a 4th year Honours student at the University of Windsor majoring in Communication Studies/Political Science so I 'm familiar with the political spectrum .
#Text=I ’ve owned and operated my own lawn service ( which makes me a lawntrepreneur , of sorts ) for a number of years so I ’ve become accustomed to dealing with people and satisfying their needs .
#Text=I genuinely care about people ’s concerns and always want to make them happy , much like I would do as an MPP .
#Text=Which of your competitors do you expect to pose the biggest challenge to your candidacy ? Why ?
#Text=What makes you the most desirable of all candidates running in the riding ?
#Text=Anyone who believes that government is the solution to the majority of our problems ( health care , education , and environment ) or believes taxation is good .
#Text=Our party is quite different in that we believe the government IS the problem .
#Text=In the grand scheme of things , we would take power so we could greatly reduce our own power .
#Text=Government should be kept to an absolute minimum and not rule like a tax-hungry leviathan .
#Text=What do you feel are the three most important issues to voters in your riding ?
#Text=Are these the same top three issues that are most important to you ?
#Text=What would you do to address these issues ?
#Text=The Detroit-Windsor border crossing
#Text=Wind turbines as a viable source of renewable energy
#Text=Agriculture
#Text=To address these issues I would do very little because we libertarians believe that the government prevents any real resolution .

#Text=These matters should be resolved civilly and judiciously in private courts without the government unilaterally imposing their will or without politicians being financially bribed into favouring one side .
#Text=What should be the first order of business in the 39th Legislative Assembly ?
#Text=Hypothetically , if libertarians ever gained power we would dissolve the government to an absolute minimum and immediately seeks measures to abolish taxation or curtail it as much as possible .
#Text=Are the property taxes in your riding at a fair level for the amount of services received in the municipality ?
#Text=No ; libertarians believe property owners should have exclusive rights over their land .
#Text=They bought their land and should own and control it themselves without being subject to government scrutiny .
#Text=If all other forms of taxation were abolished we would convert property taxes to fees for municipal services and introduce as much free market choice as possible .
#Text=Property owners should be the true assessors of their land ’s value , not the government .
#Text=How can the province lead the way in stimulating job creation ?
#Text=By introducing a free market which attracts businesses both small and large and does n’t deter them due to exorbitant taxation and government intervention .
#Text=What are your views on the mixed member proportional representation ( MMP ) referendum ? '
#Text=It could potentially lead to a coalition government whereby a party with the most seats forms an alliance with the party with the least seats needed to form a majority .
#Text=Subsequently , the smaller party can hold the legislature at ransom and threaten a new election if they do n’t get their way .
#Text=Elections cost taxpayers which is another problem with our system .
#Text=Why should we have to pay for such shenanigans ?
#Text=The MMP is good for name recognition and exposure but can lead to chaos .
#Text=What role , if any , does " new media " play in your campaign , and the campaign of your party ?
#Text=( websites , blogs , Facebook , YouTube videos , etc ) Do you view it as beneficial , or a challenge ?
#Text="

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=The medium is the message  , as our good friend Marshall McLuhan once said .
